page.title: 15Crime in Linlithgow
page.content: Being a community town,Linlithgow does not have a high crime rate.There are ten officers stationed here and they work a system of three eight-hour shifts.They can have assistance from headquarters in Livingston. Perhaps the most common crime is break-ins-to cars rather than to houses or shops.Vandalism is prevalant but frequently is not reported to the police. Parking in Linlithgow is a major problem,but traffic wardens from Bathgate take some of the pressure off the police.A parking offence will cost the offender a fine of Â£10 with three weeks to pay. Glue-sniffing is not popular. Youngsters here seem to realise the danger.Shoplifting does not occur often as there are only two large stores in the town.
